intro: Murdannia malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to the Indian subcontinent, particularly found in regions like Kerala and Karnataka. The plant is characterized by its erect herbaceous stem and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Murdannia malabarica is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to moist environments.
